title: sans serif with rounded edges
content:
Hello hello there you crazy typophiliacs!

I'm happy to be amongst like-minded folks at last. This is my very first post on this site, and I'm not entirely sure what to expect. Anyhow, I'll trow my thoughts out there anyways..

So basically I'm looking for a tres cool sans-serif typeface with rounded edges. Pardon my lack of adequate vocab here...part of the reason why I'd like to join is because I'd like to broaden my horizon when it comes to such things. So please be patient with me...

Does anyone have any suggestions?

Merci in advance  
\
author: dinocopter

comments.content: I very much like [Barmeno](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/barmeno-be/), as you will see from my avatar.
I prefer the proportions of Barmeno; to me Sari's curves are not taut enough, and it looks too round and spacey. I love the pound sign and lining figures of Barmeno. Maybe it's just me?

Other possibilities:  
 [ITC Officina](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-officina-sans/) (no sharp corners)  
 [GD Maiandra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/maiandra/) (more informal)  
or [LET Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/frankfurter/) (more cartoony)
FF Max has to be my new fave.

I'm into the same research, hope I'm not too late:  
 [Estilo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.dstype.com/main.htm) from DSType  
 [Albert](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts.php?font_num=100) from FontSmith  
 [Sophie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts.php?font_num=101) from FontSmith  
 [Skyler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.sparkytype.com/fonts.php?font=Skyler) from SparkyType (also check Chicken)  
 [Courier Sans, Superstudio and Gravur](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.lineto.com/) from Lineto  
 [P22 Platten](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=IHT0000124)  
 [Grover Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000059)  
 [Grover](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000058)  
 [Hermes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=3) from Optimo  
 [Sansa Soft](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.ourtype.be/) from OurType

Hope this helped!

momo  
––  
All Good Cretins Go To Heaven

Without pretension, I would suggest Foco from Dalton Maag, [http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco "http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco")

It has a softly round and friendly feel.

Nice suggestion Haag.  
Dalton Maag also offers [Tondo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002714/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/tondo/standard), whose name says it all!

momo  
––  
All Good Cretins Go To Heaven
